channel.title: How To Set Up A TOR Middlebox Routing All VirtualBox Virtual Machine Traffic Over The TOR Network?
channel.description:
How To Set Up How To Set Up A TOR Middlebox Routing All VirtualBox Virtual Machine Traffic Over The TOR Network?
https://www.howtoforge.com/how-to-set-up-a-tor-middlebox-routing-all-virtualbox-virtual-machine-traffic-over-the-tor-network is exact what I want. But the error following in Ubuntu 18.04:
A TOR Middlebox Routing All VirtualBox Virtual Machine Traffic Over The TOR Network?
https://www.howtoforge.com/how-to-set-up-a-tor-middlebox-routing-all-virtualbox-virtual-machine-traffic-over-the-tor-network is exact what I want. But the error following in Ubuntu 18.04:
root@lbaa:~# lsof -i :53 > COMMAND PID USER FD TYPE DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME > systemd-r 426 systemd-resolve 12u IPv4 752 0t0 UDP localhost:domain > systemd-r 426 systemd-resolve 13u IPv4 753 0t0 TCP localhost:domain (LISTEN) > root@lbaa:~# /etc/init.d/dnsmasq restart > [....] Restarting dnsmasq (via systemctl): dnsmasq.serviceJob for dnsmasq.service failed because the control process exited with error code. > See "systemctl status dnsmasq.service" and "journalctl -xe" for details. > failed!
root@lbaa:~# systemctl status dnsmasq.service ● dnsmasq.service - dnsmasq - A lightweight DHCP and caching DNS server Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/dnsmasq.service; enabled; vendor preset: enabled) Active: failed (Result: exit-code) since Sun 2018-05-13 11:56:52 UTC; 11s ago Process: 1856 ExecStart=/etc/init.d/dnsmasq systemd-exec (code=exited, status=2) Process: 1855 ExecStartPre=/usr/sbin/dnsmasq --test (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
May 13 11:56:52 lbaa systemd[1]: Starting dnsmasq - A lightweight DHCP and caching DNS server... May 13 11:56:52 lbaa dnsmasq[1855]: dnsmasq: syntax check OK. May 13 11:56:52 lbaa dnsmasq[1856]: dnsmasq: failed to create listening socket for port 53: Address already in use May 13 11:56:52 lbaa dnsmasq[1856]: failed to create listening socket for port 53: Address already in use May 13 11:56:52 lbaa dnsmasq[1856]: FAILED to start up May 13 11:56:52 lbaa systemd[1]: dnsmasq.service: Control process exited, code=exited status=2 May 13 11:56:52 lbaa systemd[1]: dnsmasq.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'. May 13 11:56:52 lbaa systemd[1]: Failed to start dnsmasq - A lightweight DHCP and caching DNS server.

item.description:
ciocleaw:

Or, how do I setup a remote computer as I have 2 computers in hand?

Unsupported.

Unsupported

item.title: How To Set Up A TOR Middlebox Routing All VirtualBox Virtual Machine Traffic Over The TOR Network?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
ciocleaw:

what’s the password of the account: tunnel? when I issue sudo -u tunnel /path/to/proxyprogram it asks for password.

It’s actually most likely asking for the user’s password so you can use sudo. See:

Whonix

Default Passwords

Whonix ™ Default Passwords

Read full topic

item.description:
Is this article:Connect to a Proxy Before Tor: User -> Proxy -> Tor -> Internet

Whonix

Tunnels/Connecting to a proxy before Tor

Instructions on how to connect to a proxy before Tor (User -> proxy -> Tor -> Internet)

what’s the password of the account: tunnel? when I issue sudo -u tunnel /path/to/proxyprogram it asks for password.

Or, how do I setup a remote computer as I have 2 computers in hand?

Read full topic

Please read through the links entr0py provided. Most (all ?) of the Whonix specific lantern documentation can be found there.

entr0py:

https://forums.whonix.org/search?q=lantern

do you have other idea to the Tor connection

item.title: How To Set Up A TOR Middlebox Routing All VirtualBox Virtual Machine Traffic Over The TOR Network?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi ciocleaw

I believe this may be what your looking for:

Whonix

Other Operating Systems

Anonymize any Operating System! Your operating system tunneled through the Tor Anonymity Network! Create your Custom-Whonix-Workstation!

Related:

Whonix

Multiple Whonix-Workstations

Compartmentalization. Better separation of different tasks and/or pseudonyms by using multiple Whonix-Workstations.

Read full topic

is exact what I want. But the error following in Ubuntu 18.04:

Howtoforge

How To Set Up A TOR Middlebox Routing All VirtualBox Virtual Machine Traffic...

How To Set Up A TOR Middlebox Routing All VirtualBox Virtual Machine Traffic Over The TOR Network This tutorial will show you how to reroute all ...


is exact what I want. But the error following in Ubuntu 18.04:

root@lbaa:~# lsof -i :53

COMMAND    PID            USER   FD   TYPE DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME
systemd-r  426 systemd-resolve   12u  IPv4    752      0t0  UDP localhost:domain 
systemd-r  426 systemd-resolve   13u  IPv4    753      0t0  TCP localhost:domain (LISTEN)

[....] Restarting dnsmasq (via systemctl): dnsmasq.serviceJob for dnsmasq.service failed because the control process exited with error code.
See "systemctl status dnsmasq.service" and "journalctl -xe" for details.
